column4: Does the "Remote Desktop Server" that comes with Ubuntu work with the Remote Desktop Client that comes with windowsXP?
You can use apt-get install tsclient to connect to other Windows RDP servers, but that might be the reverse of what you want
Although if you want to go the other way, I find VNC to be very unnecessary, all you need to go the other way is ssh -CX
Are you sure you need VNC? I used to have a VNC server setup on my home machine, but honestly ssh -CX seems to do everything I need it to
when I do ssh -CX nothing happens... gives me a list of ssh commands
You need to install an ssh server on the server machine. Then from the client you would do ssh -CX the.ip.address.ofserver
I tried setting up this; https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNCOverSSH
I see what you tried to do, let me ask you this, are you connecting from an ubuntu machine to another ubuntu machine, or ubuntu to windows, or windows to ubuntu
If you are doing windows to ubuntu I would recommend just setting up an ssh server on the ubuntu machine. And I think you can use ssh -CX to forward the output of whatever app y ou want
On the ubuntu machine, ps aux | grep ssh
You didn't setup the server correctly :)
that's what I'm assuming, must have missed something somewhere
Could be a lack of port forwarding on the router, who knows
DMZ is set for both machines
Then that's not possible?
the firmware for my router allows for dual DMZ
DMZ means, hey, all traffic that isn't set to go to a specific machine go here. You can't have 2 machines setup to do that?
Well, I wouldn't actually do it, because conceptually that makes zero sense to me :)
ah well, have to eat, then time to mess around again, back in a bit, thanks for your help
Port forwarding
Your router doesn't know where to send the traffic, you need to tell it
